description: Manually defined error patterns for common Cisco IOS errors

patterns.description: Configuration commands executed in privileged exec mode instead of global config mode

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' requires global configuration mode. You are currently in privileged exec mode (indicated by the '#' prompt without '(config)'). Configuration commands like 'hostname', 'enable secret', and 'banner' can only be executed in global configuration mode.

fix.template: First enter global configuration mode by typing 'configure terminal' (or 'conf t'), then retry the command: {command}

metadata.documentation_reference: Configuration commands require entering global configuration mode with 'configure terminal' first

patterns.description: Interface configuration commands executed outside of interface config mode

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' requires interface configuration mode. You must first enter global configuration mode and then select a specific interface. Commands like 'ip address', 'ipv6 address', 'no shutdown', and 'description' are only valid within an interface's configuration context.

fix.template: Enter global config mode, select an interface, then retry: configure terminal, interface <interface-name>, {command}

metadata.documentation_reference: Interface-specific commands require entering interface configuration mode first
